body_html:
A full reproducible example is generally useful, I can't tell what code you used to generate the numbers.

However, in process of making sanity check, I found a similar looking bug, reopened here with self-contained example #7038 (comment)

Current work-around is to create session with tf.OptimizerOptions.L0

config = tf.ConfigProto(graph_options=tf.GraphOptions(optimizer_options=tf.OptimizerOptions(opt_level=tf.OptimizerOptions.L0)))
sess = tf.InteractiveSession(config=config)
body_text:
A full reproducible example is generally useful, I can't tell what code you used to generate the numbers.
However, in process of making sanity check, I found a similar looking bug, reopened here with self-contained example #7038 (comment)
Current work-around is to create session with tf.OptimizerOptions.L0
config = tf.ConfigProto(graph_options=tf.GraphOptions(optimizer_options=tf.OptimizerOptions(opt_level=tf.OptimizerOptions.L0)))
sess = tf.InteractiveSession(config=config)
body:
A full reproducible example is generally useful, I can't tell what code you used to generate the numbers.

However, in process of making sanity check, I found a similar looking bug, reopened here with self-contained example https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/7038#issuecomment-282798791

Current work-around is to create session with `tf.OptimizerOptions.L0`

```
config = tf.ConfigProto(graph_options=tf.GraphOptions(optimizer_options=tf.OptimizerOptions(opt_level=tf.OptimizerOptions.L0)))
sess = tf.InteractiveSession(config=config)

```
